modules.description: Creates SVG attribute values by converting strings into specialized attribute types. Operates on string inputs to generate properties for elements like viewBox, width, height, fill, and transform. Used to construct SVG elements with precise styling and positioning parameters.

Provides functions to create SVG elements with attributes and styles, and to construct virtual DOM nodes. Works with strings, attribute lists, and browser element types. Used to generate dynamic SVG content with inline styling and custom attributes.

Adds inline CSS styles to HTML elements by taking a property name and value, returning a V.attr. Works with string-based style properties and attribute structures. Used to dynamically apply font sizes, colors, and layout properties within HTML elements.

Converts string inputs into specialized SVG attribute values, enabling precise control over element properties such as viewBox, fill, and transform. Supports operations that generate structured data for use in SVG element construction. Examples include creating numeric values, color codes, and transformation matrices from raw strings. Facilitates the creation of visually accurate and dynamically configured SVG graphics.

Provides functions to render shapes, handle user input, and animate graphical elements. Works with types such as colors, coordinates, and time intervals to build interactive visual content. Enables creation of educational visualizations and simple games by combining geometric primitives and event-driven logic.

provides functions for generating and manipulating SVG and HTML elements through attribute and style management. It includes tools to create virtual DOM nodes, apply inline styles, and convert strings into precise SVG attribute values. Operations support dynamic content generation, such as setting font sizes, colors, and transformation matrices. Examples include building SVG graphics with custom viewBox settings and styling HTML elements with programmatic color changes.

This module offers functions for generating time-based numerical patterns and creating graphical shapes with color attributes, operating on numbers, time, colors, and coordinates. It enables manipulation of visual elements through transformations like scaling, rotation, and fading, alongside input mapping for applications involving animations, games, and interactive graphics. Specific use cases include rendering dynamic visual effects, composing interactive interfaces, and managing game states through structured data types.
